radiographic_examinations.findings: Mild atelectatic change in the lung bases; right lower lobe 6-mm nodular opacity; gallbladder wall thickening likely perforated along the posterior margin with adjacent fat stranding; dominant fluid collection seen along the inferior edge of the liver adjacent to the gallbladder measuring approximately 5.5 x 2.0 cm; surrounding mild hyperemia in adjacent liver segment; smaller areas of hypoenhancement in the liver likely represent perfusion abnormalities or focal fatty infiltration; otherwise unremarkable liver, spleen, pancreas, and adrenals; no dilatation of the common duct; kidneys in normal anatomic locations; severe atherosclerotic calcifications in abdominal aorta and iliac vessels; small right fat-containing inguinal hernia; multiple old posterior right-sided rib fractures without evidence of malignancy or infection.
